Observed Differences in. Ciliatoxicity of Cigarette Smoke
due to Exposure Methods
T. Dalhamn, M.D.
R. Rylander, X.D.
A.W. Spears, Ph.D.
Because of the possible alteratione of the normal functioning.
of the reapiratory tract which could be brought about by
ciliastasis, the ciliatoxie activity of various agenta has
been studied by several inveatigators. A variety of experimental
models have been reported for the measurement of ciiiatoxieity -
many of these methods were reviewed by Rylander (l966), who
also indicated that contradietory reporto concerning the ciliatoxi.
properties of various compounds might be at least partly explained
by differences in the experimental modela used.
